ud5.5:1.2: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in the Eastern Monastery, the stilt longhouse of Migāra’s mother.
ud5.5:1.3: Now, at that time it was the sabbath, and the Buddha was sitting surrounded by the Saṅgha of monks.
ud5.5:2.1: And then, as the night was getting late, in the first watch of the night, Venerable Ānanda got up from his seat, arranged his robe over one shoulder, raised his joined palms toward the Buddha and said,
ud5.5:2.2: “Sir, the night is getting late. It is the first watch of the night, and the Saṅgha has been sitting long.
